Field.Name: LRI_CE
Field.ImpNote: The sender shall always populate the first triplet before populating other triplets; the receiver shall examine all triplets to find relevant values.

ConformanceStatement.EnglishDescription: If data is available for only one Coded Element then the triplet of CE.1 (Identifier), CE.2 (Text), and CE.3 (Name of Coding System) SHALL be valued in accordance with the rules given for CE.1, CE.2, and CE.3.

Component.Name: Identifier

ConformanceStatement.EnglishDescription: If CE.3 (Name of Coding System) is valued "LN" then CE.1 SHALL be a valid LOINC code identifier format.

Component.ImpNote: Length 1..20 LRI-CE-1: If data is available for only one Coded Element then the triplet of CE.1 (Identifier), CE.2 (Text), and CE.3 (Name of Coding System) shall be valued in accordance with the rules given for CE.1, CE.2, and CE.3.
Component.Reference: LRI-CE-1: If data is available for only one Coded Element then the triplet of CE.1 (Identifier), CE.2 (Text), and CE.3 (Name of Coding System) shall be valued in accordance with the rules given for CE.1, CE.2, and CE.3.

Component.Name: Text
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..199 C(R/RE) It is strongly recommended that text be sent to accompany any identifier. When a coded value is not known, text can still be sent, in which case no coding system should be identified.
Component.Reference: LRI-CE-2: If CE.1 (Identifier) is not valued, then CE.2 (Text) SHALL be valued.

Component.Name: Alternate Identifier

ConformanceStatement.EnglishDescription: If CE.6 (Name of AlternateCoding System) is valued "LN" then CE.4 SHALL be a valid LOINC code identifier format.

Component.ImpNote: Length 1..20 The alternate identifier (from the alternate coding system) should be the closest match for the identifier found in component 1.

Component.Name: Alternate Text
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..199 ISSUE: It should be conditional and the predicate is based on the presence of CE.4: LRI-CE-4: If CE.4 (Alternate Identifier) is valued, then CE.6 (Name of Alternate Coding System) SHALL be valued. It is strongly recommended that alternate text be sent to accompany any alternate identifier.
Component.Reference: LRI-CE-4: If CE.4 (Alternate Identifier) is valued, then CE.6 (Name of Alternate Coding System) SHALL be valued.

Component.Name: Name of Alternate Coding System
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..12 C(R/X) Lab to EHR Condition predicate: Required if an alternate identifier is provided in component 4.

Component.Name: Identifier

ConformanceStatement.EnglishDescription: If CWE.3 (Name of Coding System) is valued "LN" then CWE.1 SHALL be a valid LOINC code identifier format.

Component.ImpNote: Length 1..20 LRI-CWE.a-1: If data is available for only one Coded Element then the triplet of CWE.1 (Identifier), CWE.2 (Text), and CWE.3 (Name of Coding System) shall be valued in accordance with the rules given for CE.1, CE.2, and CE.3.

Component.Name: Text
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..199, C(RE/X) LRI-CWE.a-2: If CWE.1 (Identifier) is empty then CWE.2 (Text) SHALL NOT be valued.

Component.Name: Name of Coding System
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..12, C(R/X) LRI-CWE.a-3: If CWE.1 (Identifier) is populated then CWE.3 (Name of Coding System) SHALL be valued.

Component.Name: Alternate Identifier

ConformanceStatement.EnglishDescription: If CWE.6 (Name of AlternateCoding System) is valued "LN" then CWE.4 SHALL be a valid LOINC code identifier format.

Component.ImpNote: Length 1..20, C(RE/X) The alternate identifier (from the alternate coding system) should be the closest match for the identifier found in component 1. LRI-CWE.a-4: If CWE.4 (Alternate Identifier) is populated then CWE.6 (Name of Alternate Coding System) SHALL be valued.

Predicate.EnglishDescription: If CWE_CR.3 (Name of Coding System) is not an HL7 defined table.

Component.Name: Original Text
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..199, C(R/RE) Note : Original Text is used to convey the text that was the basis for coding. If neither the first or second triplet has values, this contains the text of the field. LRI-CWE.a-6: If CWE.1 (Identifier) and CWE.4 (Alternate Identifier) are not populated, then CWE.9 (Original Text) SHALL be valued. LRI-CWE.a-7: If the triplets identified by elements CWE.1 (Identifier), CWE.2 (Text) and CWE.3 (Name of Coding System) and CWE.4 (Alternate Identifier), CWE.5 (Alternate Text), and CWE.6 (Name of Alternate Coding System) are not valued then CWE.9 (Original Text) shall be valued.

Component.Name: Second Name of Alternate Coding System
Component.ImpNote: WARNING: the table should be specified for an ID type.

Component.Name: Second Alternate Coding System Version ID
Second Alternate Value Set Version ID

ConformanceStatement.EnglishDescription: If CWE.3 (Name of Coding System) is valued "LN" then CWE.1 SHALL be a valid LOINC code identifier format.

Component.Name: Text
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..199 Note : It is strongly recommended that text be sent to accompany any identifier.

Component.Name: Alternate Identifier

ConformanceStatement.EnglishDescription: If CWE.6 (Name of AlternateCoding System) is valued "LN" then CWE.4 SHALL be a valid LOINC code identifier format.

Component.ImpNote: Length 1..20 Note : The alternate identifier (from the alternate coding system) should be the closest match for the identifier found in CWE_CR.1.

Component.Name: Alternate Text
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..199 Note : It is strongly recommended that alternate text be sent to accompany any alternate identifier.

Component.Name: Name of Alternate Coding System
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..12 C(R/X) Required if an alternate identifier is provided in component 4.

Predicate.EnglishDescription: If CWE_CR.3 (Name of Coding System) is not an HL7 defined table.

Component.Name: Alternate Coding System Version ID
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..10 ISSUE: It should be conditional- Required if an alternate coding system is identified in component 6. However, the particular coding system indicates versioning should be handled will be appropriate here. The length has been increased to handle longer versioning strings.

Component.Name: Original Text
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..199 Note : Original Text is used to convey the text that was the basis for coding.

Component.Name: Second Name of Alternate Coding System
Second Alternate Coding System Version ID
Second Alternate Value Set Version ID

Field.Name: LRI_CWE_CR1
Field.ImpNote: Components 10-22 are pre-adopted from V2.7.1 CWE.

ConformanceStatement.EnglishDescription: If CWE.3 (Name of Coding System) is valued "LN" then CWE.1 SHALL be a valid LOINC code identifier format.

Component.Name: Text
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..199 Note : It is strongly recommended that text be sent to accompany any identifier.

Predicate.EnglishDescription: If CWE_CR1.3 (Name of Coding System) is not an HL7 defined table.

Component.Name: Alternate Coding System Version ID
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..10 ISSUE: It should be conditional- Required if an alternate coding system is identified in component 6. However, the particular coding system indicates versioning should be handled will be appropriate here. The length has been increased to handle longer versioning strings.

Component.Name: Original Text
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..199 Note : Original Text is used to convey the text that was the basis for coding.

Component.Name: Second Name of Alternate Coding System
Second Alternate Coding System Version ID
Second Alternate Value Set Version ID

ConformanceStatement.EnglishDescription: If CWE.3 (Name of Coding System) is valued "LN" then CWE.1 SHALL be a valid LOINC code identifier format.

Component.Name: Text
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..199 Note : It is strongly recommended that text be sent to accompany any identifier.

Component.Name: Alternate Identifier

ConformanceStatement.EnglishDescription: If CWE.6 (Name of AlternateCoding System) is valued "LN" then CWE.4 SHALL be a valid LOINC code identifier format.

Component.ImpNote: Length 1..20 Note : The alternate identifier (from the alternate coding system) should be the closest match for the identifier found in CWE_CRO.1.

Component.Name: Alternate Text
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..199 Note : It is strongly recommended that alternate text be sent to accompany any alternate identifier.

Predicate.EnglishDescription: If CWE_CRO.3 (Name of Coding System) is not an HL7 defined table.

Component.Name: Alternate Coding System Version ID
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..10 ISSUE: It should be conditional- Required if an alternate coding system is identified in component 6. However, the particular coding system indicates versioning should be handled will be appropriate here. The length has been increased to handle longer versioning strings.

Component.Name: Original Text
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..199 Note : Original Text is used to convey the text that was the basis for coding.

Component.Name: Second Name of Alternate Coding System
Second Alternate Coding System Version ID
Second Alternate Value Set Version ID
Check Digit Scheme
Component.ImpNote: Length 3..3 C(O/X) ISSUE: The table is missing. The predicate is missing.

Component.Name: Assigning Authority
Component.ImpNote: The Assigning Authority component is used to identify the system, application, organization, etc. that assigned the ID Number in component 1.
Component.Reference: LRI-CX.a-1: The CX.4 (Assigning Authority) SHALL use the HD-GU datatype definition.

Component.Name: ID Number
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..15 The ID Number component combined with the Assigning Authority component must uniquely identify the associated object, i.e., any object with which the field is associated. Note - despite the component being named _ID Number_ this component is an ST string data type, not numeric, so the component is not limited to just numbers.

Component.Name: Check Digit Scheme
Component.ImpNote: Length 3..3 C(O/X) ISSUE: The table should be specified. The predicate is missing.

Component.Name: Assigning Authority
Component.Reference: LRI-CX-1: The CX.4 (Assigning Authority) SHALL use the HD-NG datatype definition.

Component.Name: Namespace ID
Component.Reference: LRI-EI.a-2: CE.2 (Namespace ID) SHALL be valued with an ISO-compliant OID.

Component.Name: Universal ID

ConformanceStatement.EnglishDescription: EI_GU.3 (Universal ID) SHALL be valued with an ISO-compliant OID.

Component.ImpNote: Length 1..199. LRI-EI.a-2: EI.3 (Namespace Universal ID) SHALL be valued with an ISO-compliant OID.

Component.Name: Universal ID Type

ConformanceStatement.EnglishDescription: EI_GU.4 (Universal ID Type) SHALL contain the value "ISO".

Component.Reference: LRI-EI.a-1: CE.4 (Universal ID Type) SHALL contain the value _ISO_.

Predicate.EnglishDescription: If EI_NG.3 (Universal ID) is not valued.
If EI_NG.2 (Namespace ID) is not valued.

Component.Name: Placer Assigned Identifier
Component.Reference: LRI-EIP.a-1: The datatype EI-GU SHALL be used for EIP.1 (Placer Assigned Identifier) and EIP.2 (Filler Assigned Identifier).

Component.Name: Filler Assigned Identifier
Component.Reference: LRI-EIP.a-1: The datatype EI-GU SHALL be used for EIP.1 (Placer Assigned Identifier) and EIP.2 (Filler Assigned Identifier).

Component.Name: Placer Assigned Identifier
Component.Reference: LRI-EIP.b-1: The datatype EI-NG SHALL be used for EIP.1 (Placer Assigned Identifier) and EIP.2 (Filler Assigned Identifier).

Component.Name: Filler Assigned Identifier
Component.Reference: LRI-EIP.b-1: The datatype EI-NG SHALL be used for EIP.1 (Placer Assigned Identifier) and EIP.2 (Filler Assigned Identifier).

Component.Name: Namespace ID
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..20 The value of HD_GU.1 reflects a local code that represents the combination of HD_GU.2 and HD_GU.3.

Component.Name: Universal ID

ConformanceStatement.EnglishDescription: HD_GU.2 (Universal ID) SHALL be valued with an ISO-compliant OID.

Component.Reference: LRI-HD.a-1: HD.2 (Universal ID) SHALL be valued with an ISO-compliant OID.

Component.Name: Universal ID Type

ConformanceStatement.EnglishDescription: HD_GU.3 (Universal ID Type) SHALL contain the value "ISO".

Component.Reference: LRI-HD.a-2: HD.3 (Universal ID Type) SHALL contain the value "ISO".

Predicate.EnglishDescription: if HD_NG.2 (Universal ID) is not valued
If HD_NG.1 (Namespace ID) is not valued

ConformanceStatement.EnglishDescription: Format : YYYY[MM[DD[HH[MM[SS[.S[S[S[S]]]]]]]]]+/-ZZZZ WITH YYYY = R, MM = O, DD = O, HH = O, MM = O, SS = O, [.S[S[S[S]]]] = O, +/-ZZZZ = C(R/O) If TimeZone Offset Profile
Format : YYYY[MM[DD[HH[MM[SS[.S[S[S[S]]]]]]]]]+/-ZZZZ WITH YYYY = R, MM = R, DD = R, HH = R, MM = R, SS = R, [.S[S[S[S]]]] = O, +/-ZZZZ = C(R/O) If TimeZone Offset Profile
Format : YYYY[MM[DD[HH[MM[SS[.S[S[S[S]]]]]]]]]+/-ZZZZ WITH YYYY = R, MM = RE, DD = RE, HH = O, MM = O, [SS[.S[S[S[S]]]]] = O, +/-ZZZZ = C(RE/O) If TimeZone Offset Profile
Format : YYYY[MM[DD[HH[MM[SS[.S[S[S[S]]]]]]]]]+/-ZZZZ WITH YYYY = R, MM = RE, DD = RE, HH = RE, MM = RE, [SS[.S[S[S[S]]]]] = O, +/-ZZZZ = C(RE/O) If TimeZone Offset Profile

Format : YYYY[MM[DD[HH[MM[SS[.S[S[S[S]]]]]]]]]+/-ZZZZ WITH YYYY = R, MM = C(R/X) If TS.4 (YYYY) is not valued '0000', DD = C(R/X) If TS.4 (YYYY) is not valued '0000', HH = C(RE/X) If TS.4 (YYYY) is not valued '0000', MM = C(RE/X) If TS.4 (YYYY) is not valued '0000', SS[.S[S[S[S]]]] = C(O/X) If TS.4 (YYYY) is not valued '0000', +/-ZZZZ = C(RE/O) If TimeZone Offset Profile
Format : YYYY[MM[DD[HH[MM[SS[.S[S[S[S]]]]]]]]]+/-ZZZZ WITH YYYY = R, MM = R, DD = R, HH = RE, MM = RE, [SS[.S[S[S[S]]]]] = O, +/-ZZZZ = C(RE/O) If TimeZone Offset Profile
Format : YYYY[MM[DD[HH[MM[SS[.S[S[S[S]]]]]]]]]+/-ZZZZ WITH YYYY = R, MM = R, DD = R, HH = R, MM = R, SS = R, [.S[S[S[S]]]] = O, +/-ZZZZ = C(RE/O) If TimeZone Offset Profile
Format : YYYY[MM[DD[HH[MM[SS[.S[S[S[S]]]]]]]]]+/-ZZZZ WITH YYYY = R, MM = R, DD = R, HH = R, MM = R, [SS[.S[S[S[S]]]]] = O, +/-ZZZZ = C(RE/O) If TimeZone Offset Profile

Component.Name: Version ID
Component.ImpNote: Length 3..5 Restricted to 2.5.1 in this guide. Literal value: 2.5.1'

Component.Name: State or Province
Component.ImpNote: State Value Set The 2 letter (alpha) codes should be used here. ISSUE: Length should be constrained accordingly.

Component.Name: Country
Component.ImpNote: Length = 3..3 Use 3-character (alphabetic) form of ISO 3166 for HL7 Table 0399 as defined in HL7 Chapter 2, Section 2.15.9.17.

Component.Name: Address Validity Range
Component.ImpNote: Deprecated as of HL7 Version 2.5. See XAD-13 Effective Date and XAD-14 Expiration Date components.

Component.Name: ID Number
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..15. The ID Number component combined with the Assigning Authority component (component 9) must uniquely identify the associated person. Note - despite the component being named _ID Number_ this component is an ST string data type, not numeric, so the component is not limited to just numbers.
Component.Reference: LRI-XCN-1: If XCN.1 (ID Number) is valued, XCN.13 (Identifier Type Code) SHALL be valued.

Component.Name: Second and Further Given Names or Initials Thereof
Assigning Authority
Component.ImpNote: The Assigning Authority component is used to identify the system, application, organization, etc. that assigned the ID Number in component 1. C(R/X)
Component.Reference: LRI-XCN-4: If XCN.1 (ID Number) is valued, XCN.9 (Assigning Authority) MAY be valued.

Component.Name: Check Digit Scheme
Component.ImpNote: Length 3..3 C(O/X) The condition predicate is missing.

Component.Name: Professional Suffix
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..199. Suggest using values from HL7 table 360.

Component.Name: ID Number
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..15. The ID Number component combined with the Assigning Authority component (component 9) must uniquely identify the associated person. Note - despite the component being named _ID Number_ this component is an ST string data type, not numeric, so the component is not limited to just numbers.
Component.Reference: LRI-XCN-1: If XCN.1 (ID Number) is valued, XCN.13 (Identifier Type Code) SHALL be valued.

Component.Name: Second and Further Given Names or Initials Thereof
Assigning Authority
Component.ImpNote: The Assigning Authority component is used to identify the system, application, organization, etc. that assigned the ID Number in component 1. C(RE/X)
Component.Reference: LRI-XCN-4: If XCN.1 (ID Number) is valued, XCN.9 (Assigning Authority) MAY be valued.

Component.Name: Check Digit Scheme
Component.ImpNote: Length 3..3 C(O/X) The condition predicate is missing

Component.Name: Organization Name
Component.Reference: LRI-XON.a-1: XON.1 (Organization Name) or XON.10 (Organization Identifier) SHALL be valued.

Component.Name: ID Number
Component.ImpNote: (Deprecated as of HL7 Version 2.5.) Use XON-10 Organization Identifier.

Component.Name: Check Digit Scheme
Component.ImpNote: Length 3..3. C(O/X) The condition predicate is missing

Component.Name: Assigning Authority
Component.ImpNote: The Assigning Authority component is used to identify the system, application, organization, etc. that assigned the ID in component 10. C(R/X)
Component.Reference: LRI-XON.a-3: XON.6 (Assigning Authority) and XCN.8 (Assigning Facility) and SHALL use datatype HD-GU.

Component.Name: Organization Identifier

Predicate.EnglishDescription: If XON_GU.1 (Organization Name) is not valued

Component.ImpNote: Length 1..20 C(R/RE) ISSUE: Select either XON.1 to XON.10 to simplify unnecessary complexity.

Component.Name: Organization Name
Component.Reference: LRI-XON.b-1: XON.1 (Organization Name) or XON.10 (Organization Identifier) SHALL be valued.

Component.Name: ID Number
Component.ImpNote: (Deprecated as of HL7 Version 2.5.) Use XON-10 Organization Identifier.

Component.Name: Organization Identifier

Predicate.EnglishDescription: If XON_NG.1 (Organization Name) is not valued

Component.ImpNote: Length 1..20. ISSUE: Select either XON.1 to XON.10 to simplify unnecessary complexity.

Name Validity Range
Component.ImpNote: Deprecated as of HL7 Version 2.5. See XPN-12 Effective Date and XPN-13 Expiration Date components.
